HE WAS GOINGTO GET OFF BACK AT THE SWITCH AFTER DETERMINING THE TRACK WAS CLEAR AND MAKE THIS MOVE.  ENGINEER STARTED PULLING EAST, MOVED ABOUT 6 TO 8 CARLENGTHS, AND THEN STOPPED THE MOVEMENT, SAYING THEY ARE PULLING TOO HARD, THERE MUST BE SOMTHING WRONG.  "CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND THE 14TH, 17TH, 18TH, AND 19TH, CARS FROM THE ENGINE DERAILED. CARS DERAILED ON WESTWARD MOVEMENT, AND TRACK DAMAGE DONEWHEN THE CARS WERE PULLED BACK EAST. ST PAUL TRANSFER, ENROUTE TO THE MINNESOTA COMMERCIAL WITH THREE UNITS, CP 8270, SOO 2403 AND CP 8263, PULLING 25 LOADS, FIVE EMPTIES, 2,919 ETT, TRAVELING WEST AT APPROXIMATELY16 MPH, WHEN LEAD UNIT CP 8270 INCURRED A FLASH-OVER IN THE MAIN GENERATOR CAUSING THE AIR FILTERSTO CATCH FIRE, RESULTING IN AN EXPLOSION WHICH CAUSED AIR BOX COVERS TO BE DISLODGED AS WELL AS ICECREAM BOX COVER.  CREW STOPPED TRAIN AND EXITED OUTSIDE ONTO THE FRONT OF THE ENGINE TO AVOID THE SMOKE, BUT DID NOT INHALE SOME CAUSING SORE THROATS AND TIGHTNESS IN CHEST.  BOTH EMPLOYEES HAVE INCURRED LOST TIME.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

163206-d-01-05-01-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 425-04 OPERATING OVER BNSF TRACKAGE WAS CROSSING OVER AT THE EAST CROSSOVER SWITCH, FROM BNSF#1 MAIN TRACK TO BNSF #2 MAIN TRACK WHEN ALL TRUCKS OF UNITS CP740 AND CP 5653 DERAILED AND CAR FTRX972704 DERAILED R/L 1-2-3-4 DUE TO IMPROPERLY LINED SWITCH.  BNSF ADVISED THEY INCURRED $2,000 IN DAMAGES TO THEIR TRACK.    CAUSE DETERMINED TO BE ENGINEER'S MISUNDERSTANDING INSTRUCTION FROM BNSF DISPATCHER AND CONDUCTOR AND ENGINEER FAILED TO HAVE A CONCISE AND MUTUAL UNDERSTANDING OF THE INSTRUCTIONS THAT WERE GIVEN.    POSITIVE ACTION PLANS WERE GIVEN TO BOTH CREW MEMBERS FOR THEIR FAILURE TO HAVE A PROPER JOB BRIEFING AND TO PROCEED IN A MANNER IN WHICH THEY COULD HAE STOPPED FOR THE SWITCH WHICH WAS NOT PROPERLY LINED.  4/23/01:   DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF EVENT: AUTHORITY TO PASS SIGNALDISPLAYING RED TO HAND LINE WEST CROSSOVER SWITCH FOR ROUTE PER BNSF EAST HUMP DISPATCHER.   RUN BYSWITCH.  DERAILED ENGINES CP 740, CP 5653, HEAD CAR FTTX 972704.  BNSF DISPATCHER INSTRUCTIONS DIDNOT SPECIFICALLY IDENTIFY POWER SWITCH TO BE HAND OPERATED.  AT THIS LOCATION THERE ARE 6 POWER SWITCHES AND EACH IS IDENTIFIED WITH A NUMBER.  USING ONLY A DIRECTIONAL IDENTIFIER THE ENGINEER MISTOOKTHE SWITCH LOCATION.  CAUSE: IMPROPER INSTRUCTIONS WERE GIVEN TO TRAIN/YARD CREW CAUSING THEM TO RUN BY SWITCH DERAILING BOTH UNITS AND LEAD CAR.  CORRECTIVE ACTION, INCLUDING DISCIPLINE:  POSITIVE ACTION PLAN GIVEN TO BOTH CREW MEMBERS.

163617-d-01-29-01-DH.Accident Cause: Broken Rail - Vertical split head   [Desc.Changed-Refer to Current/Prev.Guides]
163617-d-01-29-01-DH.Narrative: AT APPROX 0145 HRS, 1-29-01, 2330 YARD JOB MAKE A PULL FROM THE WEST YARD OFF TRACK NUMBER 2, IN A NORTHWARD MOVE WITH 25 CARS.  CREW WAS CROSSING OVER FROM WEST YARD LEAD, TO THE CANADIAN MAIN LINE AT MP 36, THROUGH THE CROSS OVERS LEADING ONTO THE SARATOGA RUNNING TRACK.  WHILE CROSSING OVER IN THE NORTH DIRECTION, THE 15TH TO THE 20TH CAR DERAILED JUST SHORT OF THE CROSSER SWITCH. BOTH CREW MEMBERS HAD STATED THAT WHEN THEY MADE PHYSICAL CHECK OF THE YARD, THERE WERE SUFFICIENT HAND BRAKES ON CARS IN THE BACK TRACK, INCLUDING AT LEAST THREE ON THE EAST END.  WHEN THE CREWWAS SHOVING BACK TO PICK UP THE TANK CAR, THE TRAIN ALLEGEDLY WENT INTO EMERGENCY BUT THE TRAIN CONSIST STILL COUPLED INTO THE TANK CAR.  THE CONDUCTOR STATES THAT HE THEN WENT BETWEEN THE CARS TO COUPLER THE AIR HOSE OF THE TANK CAR WITH THE OTHER EIGHT CARS(THOSE COUPLED TO THE LOCOMOTIVE).  WHENHE STEPPED OUT, HE OBSERVED THE OTHER CARS ROLLING AWAY FROM HIM.  HIS ATTEMPT TO STOP THE CARS WASUNSUCCESSFUL.  THE LEADING CAR OF THE TRACK, UTLX 649265, TRAVELED EASTWARD GOING OVER A MANUALLY OPERATED DERAIL THAT WAS INSTALLED ON THE EAST END OF THE TRACK.  THIS CAUSED THE CAR TO DERAIL AND OVERTURN.  BOTH CARS ARE EQUIPPED WITH A DOUBLE SHELF COUPLER.  OUR LOCOMOTIVES ARE NOT EQUIPPED, NORREQUIRED TO BE EQUIPPED WITH EVENT RECORDERS.
